alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Johnson; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:42PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Martin, southeastern Johnson, northeastern Floyd and northwestern Pike Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 441 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Endicott, or near Prestonsburg, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... McCombs and Gulnare around 445 PM EDT. Pleasant around 450 PM EDT. Heenan, Davella, Jarad, Delong, Davisport and Piso around 455 PM EDT. McClure, Moree, Prince, Threeforks, Preece, Debord and Pevier around 500 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Laura, Bradbury, Heisey, Coalpoint, Pilgrim, Hatfield Station, Lovely, Beauty, Andy, Rural, Conder, Warfield, Whitepost and Hode. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
